alert.note: Alert for Baca; Prowers (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued December 02 at 3:15PM MST until December 02 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southern Prowers County in southeastern Colorado... Northeastern Baca County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 313 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Kendall to 8 miles southwest of Holly to near McClave, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * A wall of dust will continue south across Prowers and Baca Counties. Near zero visibility is expected on Highways 287 and 160 over the next 1 to 2 hours. Winds will also shift from west to north with this wall of dust. Locations impacted include... Lamar, Walsh, Vilas, Two Buttes, Stonington and Two Buttes Reservoir. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
